title: unvaccinated nurse says prepared lose
story: Unvaccinated nurse says she is prepared to lose her job than have the Covid jabNHS frontline staff in England are required to be fully vaccinated by April  meaning they must have their first jab by early February or risk losing their jobsThe government measure means nurses must get the jab or risk losing their jobImage: AFP via Getty ImagesByMaria OkanrendeLaura SharmanFreelance writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan  An NHS nurse insisted she is prepared to risk her job rather than getting vaccinated against coronavirus. All frontline workers in England face the sackthey have not had two Covid vaccines by April , meaning they must get their first dose by February . The unvaccinated nurse, of London, told of her outrage at the mandate and called it an infringement of her human rights. How can you force me to put something in my body andI disagree then Iaposm out of a job and potentially lose my home  she told My London.I donapost know how Iaposm going to pay my mortgage, I donapost know how Iaposm going to pay my bills but itaposs a risk Iaposm willing to take for my human rights.  The nurse is based in the east London borough of Newham where  per cent of residents are yet to receive their first dose. She claims she was handed a letter from her employer stating that her team must be vaccinated by the end of March or leave their jobs. But the message has proven fruitless in persuading her to change her mind. As a healthcare professional I should be given the opportunity to make an informed decision about things affecting my body, she said. I hope someone somewhere will have common sense and bring about some sort of change. I thinkwe accept this then it opens a dangerous door to other things that the Government or other corporations can impose on our livelihoods. The nurse, who is of African descent, believes that vaccine hesitancy is strong in black and ethnic minority communities, and suggested reasons for this could be fear, hidden agendas and issues of mistrust.  Recent figures show that the  most unvaccinated areas in the UK are all in London. Almost one third of Londoners still have not received their first dose of the vaccine, according to Government data. Most of Londonaposs boroughs are lagging far behind other parts of the UK, with Westminster ranking worst overall for first dose uptake at just . per cent. By stark contrast, the five areas with the highest first dose vaccination rates in the UK are all in Scotland according to figures from January . Argyll and Bute is the most vaccinated upper tier local authority in the UK where . per cent of residents have had the first jab. Dr Raheelah Ahmad, director for global engagement at City, University of London, has studied vaccine uptake in England.We found that Asian and Black people are, respectively, twice and . times less likely to accept the Covid- vaccine than White British people, she said.The expert also highlighted the importance of analysing ethnic minority inclusion in the fight against vaccine hesitancy. Population characteristics can be used to infer vulnerability of certain communities to Covid, or to the likelihood of high levels of vaccine hesitancy, she added. Communities harder hit by the virus, or at risk of being so, stand to benefit from greater resource allocation than their population size alone would suggest. This could partly explain why the total number of people living in Newham who have received a first dose stands at almost  per cent lower than top-of-the-table Bromley. Bromley is the most vaccinated borough in London, with . per cent of residents receiving the first dose. Just  per cent of Bromleyaposs population consists of black and ethnic minority communities, while these same communities make up over  per cent of Newham, according to an ONS population census in . The London borough of Kensington and Cha is the second most unvaccinated UTLA in the UK where just . per cent of residents have had the first dose. Professor Azeem Majeed, chair in primary care and public health at Imperial College London, suggested that low vaccination rates among Londoners could also be driven by a mobile population. He said: With many living in the capital shorter term, for work or study, it can be dficult to send vaccine appointments because of inaccurate address information. For example, some Londoners will have had their vaccines overseas and won’t show up in official statistics. He added: “We need to continue to encourage people living in London and across the UK to get vaccinated and reduce their risk of catching COVID- and having a more serious illness.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON NHSUniversity of LondonImperial CollegeHuman rightsCoronavirus vaccineCoronavirusHospitals" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily coronavirus briefing with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: woman 26 learns walk again
story: Woman, , learns to walk again after miraculously surviving ft waterfall plungeCara Sutton suffered a broken spine, shattered pelvis and collapsed lung after slipping on rocks near a waterfall edge. Her boyfriend thought she was dead, but she has now learned to walk againCara Sutton suffered injuries but is now back on her feet Image: Liverpool ECHOByHollie BoneNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments A woman who survived an ft waterfall plunge has beaten the odds for a second time by learning to walk again.Cara Sutton suffered a broken spine, shattered pelvis and collapsed lung in the drop. She had slipped on rocks metres from the waterfall edge then disappeared from view, leaving boyfriend James certain she was dead.The cycling helmet Cara was wearing probably saved her le at Coed-y-Brenin,Snowdonia, North Wales.The pharmacist, , who was on holiday, said: “I remember James shouting to be careful as I fell. “I was sliding all over the place and tried to grab some moss to stop myself but it just ripped off. “The edge was behind me so I didn’t realise I was about to fall until I saw the clf go past me.”  James said it was a miracle she had her helmet on, adding: “I thought there was no way she’d survive.” Rescuers winched her out of the ravine before flying her to Royal Stoke University Hospital. Cara, from Liverpool, had several operations and spent two months learning to walk again before being discharged in November. The emergency response will feature in Channel ’s : Critical Condition tonight.  Consultant Dr Richard Fawcett said such a plunge is usually deadly, adding: “There’s rocks and boulders... a height that can kill.” Cara said: “I can’t thank the doctors and rescue teams enough. “It feels amazing considering that just the other day I walked k. title: woman makes 60k year driving
story: Woman makes £k-a-year driving for Uber and baking cakes after quitting jobKasey Clarke, , traded in her job as a producer at the BBC to start her own cake baking firm, while driving for Uber on the sideKasey Clarke took the plunge and quit her high-flying job at the BBC Image: Andor Ivan ByRachael Davis:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA woman who quit her high-flying BBC job to start a cake business now makes around £, a year and says she has no regrets. Kasey Clarke, , traded in her job as a producer to start her own firm.Kasey had worked at the BBC for  years before leaving in  to pursue baking full-time, MyLondon reports. She now runs her own successful business, Sweet Cakey Thing, which she launched in March  after spending years developing her craft and finding her niche - as well as driving for Uber in Central London on the side.These ventures combined make her up to £, a year, and she credits the flexibility of Uber for facilitating her success. In  I went full-time into baking, and financially I wasnapost  per cent prepared for that, Kasey said. I was able to keep myself going for a couple of years before I had to find another source of income to support me.I tried other avenues, working as a warehouse operative for John Lewis, as a pollster during the Brexit campaign, teaching cake decorating skills... but all of these things had the problem of being very fixed, in terms of time, in terms of income.I found juggling those very rigid timetables around impromptu cake orders very hard - I wanted to find something that was flexible to my primary needs of building my business. There are plenty of problems with the gig economy, but one thing that can be said for the likes of Uber is its flexibility. You can work when you want, where you want, and that prospect was very appealing to Kasey. I was doing the midnight sht at John Lewis, schlepping mattresses from one end of the warehouse to the other, and I kept hearing this advert for Uber. I was like: aposYou know what, I love driving, Iaposve never considered being a taxi driver before, and these guys seem to have made it really easy for me to do that. Let me look into itapos, she said. Kasey signed up for Uber, which enabled her to get her finances under control, sort out her credit score, and to be able to take on the sorts of baking jobs she really wanted to do.  Rather than keeping on churning out kidsapos birthday cakes, Kasey could start working on the beautul wedding cakes sheaposd always dreamed of, and then she started developing Sweet Cakey Thing. Sweet Cakey Thing is an award-winning naughty, natural, outrageous indulgence,  per cent aposfree fromapos cake in a jar, Kasey explains. Itaposs perfect for paleo, gluten intolerance, coeliacs, yogis, gym bunnies, and people who just want to enjoy a clean diet with absolutely no crap in there at all, just  per cent natural whole foods. Kasey spent the time leading up to the first Covid lockdown in her kitchen developing recipes, launching the brand at a yoga studio pop-up in March . Shortly afterwards, the country went into lockdown and Sweet Cakey Thing had to go entirely online. Kasey continued driving for Uber, which she says requires a great deal of management and responsibility in order to balance her business and her side hustle, but her earnings show how well it can pay off.  I start my day in Hertfordshire, where I am now, and I just go where the rides take me, she said. Iniably they take me into London, I find myself there almost every day. I tend to work less to an area and more to the clock: I clock in at six, with a view to doing six hours and be done by  so I can get back and focus on other things, getting to the kitchen or whatever needs to be done, she continued. Wherever I find myself around  oaposclock is where Iaposm looking to start making my way back towards home. Iaposm near Stansted Airport, but I find myself in East London, or South London, or West London, Central London pretty quickly. All roads lead to London, she laughed. Despite how much she loves driving for Uber, meeting new people every day and seeing every corner of London, Kasey hopes that  will be the year she can take Sweet Cakey Thing full time. Iaposm looking forward to building on where Iaposve got to in the past six months, expanding the range with new flavours, and Iaposm hoping to do a pop-up tour in the summer, she said. All of that means Iaposll be needing to spend more time with Sweet Cakey Thing and less time on the road. My TfL licence expires this August, and my agenda is to not need to review it, so come August Iaposll be a full-time entrepreneur, working on my cake business. Come August, itaposll just be aposthank you very muchapos to Uber for having gotten me to this point, for supporting me in building my dream. Dreams like Kaseyaposs are made by people shopping small and supporting local independent business, which is something many Londoners have been doing a lot more of throughout Covid. She hopes the sentiment continues as the world continues to open up again, and that people continue to shop small, and shop often. title: woman mortified after going through
story: Woman mortied after going through freebies in wedding fair goody bagRebekah, from Sittingbourne, Kent, was outraged after attending a wedding show as she was given a bag of freebies to take away with her but it contained a very outdated itemA woman named Rebekah took to Twitter after finding the offensive item Image: scuByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A woman was left aposmortiedapos after going through a bag of freebies given to her at a wedding fair - as it contained a diet cereal bar.The woman, known only as Rebekah, said she attended an event organised by The Wedding Experience and was hoping to pick up some hints and tips on how to best organise a marriage ceremony. She was given a goody bag and when she opened it she was outraged, as it contained a aposSkinny Rawapos breakfast bar, as she believe this implies brides need to diet before their big day.Rebekah took to Twitter to share her outrage at the event, held in Sittingbourne, Kent, and now the organiser has responded - defending their decision to include the item.Do you think the event organiser should have included the diet bar in the goody bag  Let us know in the comments...Rebekah said: Iaposm not the bride, Iaposm the maid of honour. We went to the wedding fair and I was slightly mortied they handed over four skinny bars, which personally I think is kinda wrong. I think it perpetuates a diet culture that I donapost think is needed. For me, itaposs more about the bar - itaposs a skinny brand, theyaposre advertising it as guilt-free, I think with everything that brides go through itaposs not a positive message to be sending. If youaposre going to put something in it, donapost choose something diet. I know itaposs just a gimmick but it can be damaging.  Itaposs insensitive, and itaposs pushing a diet culture to brides and reinforces that skinny complexanyone has had an eating disorder. Or it could create one. I donapost think it aligns with todayaposs body positivity.After attending the event, Rebekah took to Twitter to share her outrage. She wrote: I am absolutely mortied. I have just been to the wedding show in Detling Hill and received what I thought was a goody bag full of fun wedding hints and tips, instead, I find a diet bar.Read More Need I say more  In , do we really need to perpetuate the idea that brides need to diet  Tina Green, the companyaposs event director, said: We include a wide range of gts in our goody bags and last weekend this included snack bars, non-alcoholic cider and beauty vitamins, along with a selection of leaflets and magazines packed with wedding inspiration. The confectionery item is a high-protein low-calorie snack bar which the company describes as being designed for aposon-the-go snackersapos.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. It is not a meal replacement but simply a healthy and nutritious snack, so we have in no way suggested brides and grooms focus on weight loss. In recent shows weaposve included items such as popcorn, milkshakes, orange juice, body lotion, chocolate truffles, toothpaste, sunscreen and many other erse products. Not all of our free gts will suit every bride and groom but hopefully there is something interesting for everyone to enjoy after their visit to The Wedding Experience.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: woman rides horse through mcdonalds
story: Woman rides a HORSE through McDonalds drive-thru leaving customers baffledDrivers were understandably baffled when a woman on a steed joined the line of vehicles waiting to order food from a McDonalds drive-thru in Borehamwood, HertsDrivers were baffled when they saw this woman and her horse line up with other vehicles at a McDonalds drive-thru near Borehamwood, England Image: SplashNewsByBen BlochAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments These hilarious snaps have captured a horse rider ordering McDonaldaposs from the drive-thru on her steed. The incredible scenes were snapped at one of the fast-food chainaposs restaurants in Borehamwood, Herts.Normally, drivers in cars are seen ordering grub from the drive-thru, but many were understandably left baffled when a woman and her steed joined the line of vehicles waiting.When she got to the window, she dismounted and told the employee what she wanted, Bristol Livereports. Her horseaposs snout was then seen hilariously poking its snout curiously into the window - probably trying to inspect the aromas of McDonaldaposs food. The woman was then seen trotting on with a coffee in one hand as she chatted away on her mobile phone. It is unclear whether she ordered any food for her steed or decided to keep their diet to carrots and hay. Incredibly, it is not the first time McDonaldaposs customers have seen someone ordering from the drive-thru on horseback.In December, dad-of-three Simon White saw the hilarious event unfold while stopping to eat at his local McDonaldaposs in Caerphilly, Wales. The woman stood in the queue, paid at the first window and then collected her meal at the second while Simon,  took some photos of the bizarre incident. His pictures show the woman in a mustard puffer jacket and riding boots sitting on a white horse and joining the line as though nothing is out of the ordinary. She holds her purse in her hand, ready to pay for her snack, and then pays for her food while perched on her horse. The horse appeared to not be phased and waited for her to finish patiently, and the two rode off after the staff members give her her meal. Simon a vehicle parts constructor, said: I was on my way home from collecting my little one from school when we stopped by for something to eat. for our daily newsletter to keep up to date with all the essential information atwww.mirror email.We were sitting there waiting for our food when she came round the corner. I couldnapost believe it - the horse was very well-behaved though and she got served no problem, before riding off. A few of the kids who were sitting inside came out to take pictures and cheer her as they thought it was great. He added: She was served and rode off. Then I passed her on the road where she was eating the burger. My son loved it, it really made his day - he was laughing so much. I thought it was really funny as well - itaposs something you just canapost imagine seeing unless you live in the Welsh valleys. title: couple claim were turned down
story: Couple claim they were turned down by adoption agency because they are JewishGabriel and Elizabeth Rutan-Ram, of Tennessee, US, are suing the Christian-based adoption agency after they were denied foster parent training last yearElizabeth and Gabriel Rutan-Ram Image: FacebookByLaura SharmanFreelance writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan  A couple are suing the childrenaposs services department in Tennessee after an adoption agency refused to help them because they are Jewish.Gabriel and Elizabeth Rutan-Ram, of Knoxville, USA, said they were denied foster parent training and a home study certicate by Holston United Methodist Home for Children.They filed a lawsuit on Wednesday against the Christian -based agency, which is partly funded by the state, after trying to adopt a child last year. It is the first in Tennessee to challenge a new law that allows religious adoption agencies to deny service to families whose religious or moral beliefs do not match the provideraposs, their attorney told Knox News.Gabriel and Elizabeth realised they could not have biological children of their own last year and later found a child in Florida who they were excited to foster with plans to adopt, the publication added. They claim they were first told by Holston that the organisation would assist them with their out-of-state placement. But on the day they were due to begin training, they were told it only helped families who shared their Christian beliefs and the couple were unable to complete the fostering process, according to the lawsuit.  Elizabeth said: “I felt like I’d been punched in the gut. It was the first time I felt discriminated against because I am Jewish. It was very shocking and it was very hurtful that the agency seemed to think that a child would be better off in state custody than with a loving family like us.” The Rutan-Rams are currently fostering and hope to adopt a teenage girl through a separate agency with hopes of adopting again in the future, according to the US publication. Holston recently acknowledged receiving public money to offer foster care placement and training for the Tennessee Department of Child Services. It came when it sued the Biden administration last December over new federal regulations. The measures stopped government-funded health and human services programmes from discriminating due to religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, sex or same-sex marriage status. A spokesperson for the Tennessee Department of Child Services and the Tennessee Attorney Generalaposs offices declined to comment on the pending litigation. Alex Luchenitser, associate vice president and associate legal director at Americans United, issued a statement on behalf of the Rutan-Ram family. It read: The Tennessee Constitution, like the US Constitution, promises religious freedom and equality for everyone. Tennessee is reneging on that promise by allowing a taxpayer-funded agency to discriminate against Liz and Gabe Rutan-Ram because they are Jews. title: gabby petitos family florida speak
story: Gabby Petitos family in Florida to speak to FBI over unintentional mistakes in caseGabby Petitos family were in Florida today, four months after the -year-old disappeared while on a road trip around the US with boyfriend Brian LaundrieGabby Petito was murdered by partner Brian Laundrie while on a roadtrip around the US Image: gabspetito InstagramByDave BurkeSenior News Reporter:,  Jan | comments The family of murderedGabby Petito have met with the FBI for a briefing, according to reports.They were in Florida today four months after Gabby, , disappeared while on a road trip around the US with boyfriend Brian Laundrie. Laundrie strangled her to death before ing to his parentaposs home, subsequently taking his own le as a huge manhunt was launched for him.The families of Laundrie and Gabby have reached an agreement about how their joint property will be distributed, Fox News reports.Laundrieaposs parentsapos lawyer, Steven Bertolino, said he and the Petito family attorney, Rick Stafford, had been working together to come to an agreement on the distribution of property to be released from law enforcement.  A written agreement had been drawn up between them, he said. The belongings in question include a notebook found close to Laundrieaposs body, but Mr Bertolino declined to reveal which family would be keeping it. A probe into Gabbyaposs murder is still ongoing. Earlier this month an investigation found Utah police officers involved in the case made unintentional mistakes, recommending they were placed on probation.  The probe is looking at the police response into allegations of domestic violence against Laundrie. Laundrieaposs body was discovered at the Myakkahatchee Creek Environmental Park in Florida on October . The -year-old disappeared after ing from a cross-country road trip without his partner Gabby and was the lone suspect in her death. Her body had been found in a remote area in Wyoming on September , and a post-mortem confirmed she had been strangled.  A backpack and notepad belonging to Laundrie was found near his body and although the corpse had been scavenged by alligators and wild pigs, an examination of dental records proved conclusively that it was him. The Laundrie family’s attorney Steve Bertolino said in a statement to E! News: Chris and Roberta Laundrie have been informed that the cause of death was a gunshot wound to the head and the manner of death was suicide. Chris and Roberta are still mourning the loss of their son and are hopeful that these findings bring closure to both families. Gabby and Laundrie embarked on their trip in early July from New Yorkaposs Long Island, where her parents live. As they travelled through Kansas, Colorado, Utah and points west, Miss Petito documented their van le on social media.She posted her final photo to Instagram on August , the same day she last spoke to her mum by phone.They were seen quarrelling in August, with police in Utah releasing a video showing Miss Petito tearfully describing a dispute she had had with Laundrie. He was later named a person of interest in her disappearance, and on September  a federal grand jury in Wyoming indicted him on a charge of fraudulently using her bank debit card. title: man 21 said feels like
story: Man, , said he feels like hes wearing someone s face after horror crashMitch Hunter, , of Indiana, US, was left disfigured after the car he was travelling in ploughed into a pylon sending , volts of electricity through his bodyMitch Hunter was one of the first people in the world to have a full face transplant Image: tiktok @mitch.hunterByLaura SharmanFreelance writer:,  Jan  A former soldier who was electrocuted in a horric car crash when he was just  became one of the first people in the world to have a full face transplant.Mitch Hunter, now , said it feels like he is wearing someone aposs face after the tragic accident which changed his le forever in . In a heroic act, Mitch pushed his female companion out of the way when the car they were travelling in crashed into a pylon sending , volts of electricity through his body. He absorbed the bulk of the blast and suffered unimaginable pain as the electricity travelled through his body and out his face. Itaposs someone aposs face, he told followers on TikTok after undergoing the face transplant surgery. Itaposs the donoraposs beard, hair follicles come with skin. Mitch, of Indiana, USA, lost his left leg, two fingers on his right hand and his face along with part of his memory shortly before and after the incident. Despite needing extensive skin grafts from his other leg and back, Mitch did not put himself forward for a face transplant until his we fell pregnant.Now a father-of-three, Mitch explained he initially went through with it because he did not want his children to be scared of his face, reports the Daily Star.A total of  doctors spent more than  hours reconstructing his face in an operation that saw his nose and lips replaced and his facial muscles and nerves reattached.  The brave survivor has shared his experiences on TikTok in his efforts to destigmatise face transplants. He added: Before the transplant, I would get stared at, comments made, and it just wasnapost fun, itaposs so much easier to live a normal le. Itaposs changed it considerably, itaposs a lot easier to go out in public and do normal things that normal people would do. news us-news woman-sheds-massive-st-after-"Woman loses seven stone to try find a wedding dress that fitsByAbigail OLearyNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A woman has lost seven stone after finding love and being desperate to find a wedding dress that fits.Meredith Hutson, , was left devastated after trying on wedding dresses following her engagement and finding they wouldnapost zip up due to her weight.Meredith - who weighed st lb at her heaviest - set to work on losing weight in August  with just over a year to go until her wedding to now husband Steven Hutson, , and now weighs st lb.By her wedding day in November  , Meredith had lost st lb and fit into her wedding dress but she didnapost stop there, as she went on to lose another four stone and dropped eight dress sizes. Meredith, who works as a hairdresser and fitness coach, went from a dress size of  to a dress size of six in the space of two years. Meredith, from Texas, US, said: My whole le I was overweight and no matter what fad diet I tried, I would lost a little bit and then after a few months I would give up and gain it all back plus extra.When I was , I was faced with serious health issues and was concerned about my overall health and future given my weight so everyday, I was suffering from headaches, rashes, nausea, and doctors could never find a problem besides a thyroid condition.One day, I realised my health had reached this low point because of my weight and thataposs when I made the decision to start my weight loss journey. After getting engaged, the wedding motivated me to lose weight because when I was dress shopping, I had trouble fitting in dresses or doing the zip up at several stores. It was really discouraging but by my wedding day, I felt beautul and although I wasnapost at my goal weight, I was so proud of what I had accomplished. My husband has supported me so much on this journey and heaposs always encouraged me to stay on track. Meredith first started losing weight by joining a gym in August  and changing her eating habits. The fitness fanatic went from weighing st lb to st lb in just two years and is now helping others do the same. She added: In a little over two years, I lost all of that weight whilst gaining muscle mass from simply counting my macros and eating in the correct calorie deficit along with weight training six days a week. My sizes changed completely I went from a XL to a small in clothes and my bra size went from a DDD to a B. I started posting on social media when I first started losing weight and the support I was getting from others was amazing so I pushed even harder and shared more to show others that it could be done.  I then started giving others advice at that point and then found a true passion in helping others. My husband cooks for us daily and at the beginning of my journey, he worked away from home so he would spend his days teaching me everything nutrition wise so I was able to cook the right food for myself when he was away. I am still in the process of transforming my body and am still currently in a calorie deficit as of now. Although I am way pass my goal, my plan is to stay in a deficit for a little bit longer to target certain stubborn areas and then in a few months I will be doing a small bulk to strictly gain muscle mass. news weird-news craig-charles-believes-ufos-clearly-"UFO Conspiracies: Trailer for new show with Craig CharlesByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsRed Dwarf star Craig Charles has said he believesUFOs definitely exist and that heaposs seen one - as he hosts a new documentary about the phenomenon. The actor, presenter, comedian, author, and DJ is truly a Jack of all trades and now heaposs fronting a Sky History show that examines famous sightings, called UFO : Conspiracies.Craig, , said that UFOs can come in aposall dferent shapes and sizesapos, and heaposs opened up about his own spooky sighting. He said he isnapost sure what was behind the phenomenon, but on the documentary he examines evidence alongside expert astrophysicist and award-winning author Sarah Cruddas to try to get to the bottom of it.  What do you think about UFOs  Let us know in the comments...Craig became a national favourite when he starred as David Lister in hit comedy Red Dwarf, where he was, mostly, the last human alive, floating through space and encountering aliens. Craig said that his interest in UFOs, also known as Unidentied Aerial Phenomenabegan in those early days, but he was afraid to admit it. Speaking to Sky History, he said: Back in the day you would never say so because people would think you were a bit of a crank. Now, the Americans have released all this footage that clearly shows these UFOs, and UAPs are there. Iaposm not saying theyaposre not aliens but they do exist. What are they   Do the Russians and Chinese have technology that is so much more advanced from our own  That is as frightening as aliens to be sure. How can craft travel , mph then stop instantly  The G-Force alone from that would turn a human being into mush  Are they drones, or are they robots  Some of them fly and then go underwater. We have footage of that from fighter jets and aircraft carriers. What are they  Me and my friend were in Galway once, sat in his garden and these weird things flew over. The next day, there was like, lots of stuff on the news about it. People had been phoning in to report seeing alien craft flying over the skies of Galway. Me and my mate saw that but I donapost know what it was   Working alongside Sarah on the TV show, Craig is examining famous sightings and they look at a sleepy Welsh village thataposs the scene of a major sighting, evidence collected from a aposcrash siteapos, and rumours of a military cover up. Craig said: The Rendlesham Forest case is really interesting because it was the American military who reported seeing all these weird lights in the woods. These are highly trained officers who arenapost going to mistake a car headlight for a spaceship. You do wonder what they actually saw there. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. A lot of the footage thataposs just been released by the American Air Force is very compelling. You can see these things on film and theyaposre all dferent shapes. A lot of people report seeing this pyramid-shaped craft. It doesnapost have an engine and itaposs just thrusting forward and flying through the air. This pyramid shape comes up quite a lot, from many dferent sightings. Thereaposs a lot of dferent kind of craft that people have claimed to see: barrel-shaped, disc-shaped and boomerang-shaped craft.  Unfortunately, with this series, hard evidence is really thin on the ground and thataposs one thing I found a bit frustrating. Although all of the stories are told with conviction and are certainly very believable He added: I now know that these things exist. Theyaposre not a figment of anyoneaposs imagination. Even the American government admits that now. Itaposs proved to me that Iaposm not a Fraggle. Unexplained Aerial Phenomena are out there, we just donapost know what they are. Sarah Cruddas added: “We are living in an incredible time for space exploration, but we are only just beginning to scratch the surface of what is out there. Marrying together Craig’s passion and enthusiasm with my own thirst for evidence and an application of science, we have been able to explore what is going on in our skies like never before. Some of the answers are likely to be stranger than anything you could ever imagine.” Craig Charles: UFO Conspiracies aired on January  on Sky History. The channel is available on Sky , NOW, Virgin  and Talk Talk  All episodes will be available on catch up servicesDo you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: dad asks amazon message princess
story: Dad asksAmazon message from Princess Diana is a joke - but its workers real nameA dad was baffled after being greeted by Princess Diana on Amazons customer service app and initially wonderedhed stumbled across some sort of Royal conspiracyJames was baffled by the Amazon workers name Image: Kennedy News and MediaByJulia BanimSophie Norris:,  Jan | commentsAfter an Amazon order for his young sonaposs space hopper resulted in a bit of delivery confusion, James Brand was forced to contact the retail giantaposs customer service team for assistance. However, after hopping on Amazonaposs customer service chat on Tuesday to alert them to the toy having been delivered, the -year-old scientist was somewhat surprised to find himself being greeted by one of the most famous women of the th century: the late Princess Diana. After clocking the name of the rep he was speaking with, James, who had been on the train home from work at the time, couldnapost help but laugh, sending a screenshot of the image to his we Alison - before joking aposis Diana actually dead - or working for Amazon apos  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. James, of Rainhill, Merseyside, said: When I saw it I had a giggle to myself. Is this something we donapost know about Amazon  Is [Diana] actually dead  Did she fake her death and is she working at Amazon When I joined the chat and spoke to the chatbot it put me through to the advisor and thataposs what came up.Itaposs just a weird name for someone to have on the chat. I just thought it was a bit funny so I screenshotted it. He continued: I think theyaposd given themselves that nickname on the chat because when Iaposve spoken to advisors in the past, theyaposve just been normal names like Sophie. Obviously, Iaposm not sure where theyaposre based oritaposs even in the UK, but I think maybe somebody did it as a joke or theyaposd just changed it. Although declining to give further comment, Amazon has since confirmed the name is indeed real, however, it doesnapost appear that James was actually chatting with the beloved Peopleaposs Princess.In the Philippines, aposPrincessapos has ranked amongst the most popular baby names in recent years, whether or not the bearer has any royal lineage. James revealed that his we had been left equally tickled by his regal encounter: I showed the message to my we and she laughed when she saw it. She said aposwhyaposs someone put that as their username apos Friends have had the same reaction, they laughed and said it was a strange name. I shared it with a couple of friends on WhatsApp. Have you had an interesting or surprising customer service experience  Email us at yourmirror@mirror Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON AmazonPrincess DianaAppsRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news weird-news man-s-military-service-surprise-"Man tries to surprise parents after being away in the militaryByCourtney PochinSenior Audience WriterSarah Fittock:,  Jan | comments If thereaposs one thing children never want to see, no matter how old they might get, itaposs their parents having sex. One -year-old son has unfortunatley witnessed just that recently - and to make matters worse, the incredibly awkward moment was caught on camera. Joseph Pena had been away from his family in Colorado, USA, for the last two years completing military service in Germany.Heaposd decided to try and surprise his parents with a visit home and showed up unnanounced, giving his mum and dad a much bigger surprise than heaposd bargained for.His mum Kaati,  and dad Richard, , were aposcaught in the actapos as Joseph barged into their room without knocking first.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. The couple refer to what their son saw as them apostalkingapos as this is the codeword they used for sex when the kids were little. Their very intimate aposdiscussionapos understandably left Joseph mortied and unable to face his parents for a while. Mum Kaati recalls: We were surprised and beyond embarrassed. My husband and I were talking, which was our code word for sex when the kids were little, and we were in the moment when the door got kicked open. I screamed because I saw my son and of course realised he saw everything exposed. She continued to say: We had no clue that our son Joseph was coming home on his RR and he told his sister Josephine, the camera lady, that he wanted to surprise us.The online responses have been epic! The comments are on fire and most are roasting our son for not knocking. To this day it’s still being viewed, and comments are still pouring in.Our poor son was scarred during his RR and spent most of his time with his sister and his girlfriend. The mum added that Joseph then aposavoidedapos coming over to their house for the remainder of his down time, instead opting to text and call his parents. We were okay with it because he needed to enjoy his RR and not be scarred by what he saw. title: mum sparks debate after admits
story: Mum sparks debate after she admits her kids fly in business classTravel blogger and mum, Alexis sparked a debate amongst users on TikTok after she posted a video of her children flying first class as some people said they should be allowedAlexis kids fly first class Image: tiktok @worldtraveladventurersByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA mum has gone viral online after she posed a question about whether children be allowed to travel in business and first-class on planes. American blogger and mum, Alexis often shares videos of her travels, useful tips and destination recommendations on TikTok, where sheaposs known as @worldtraveladventurers. But in a recent video, that has been viewed more than , times, she sparked a debate about travel etiquette as she asked what the right age is for kids to be allowed in upper classes on planes. Do you think kids should be allowed to fly business class  she captioned the post. The video shows her two children, Ellie and Christophe, flying first class on a number of trips.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. If parents can buy them a seat in business class, then they have the right to be there, she says in the video. We do think itaposs important though, for parents to teach kids to have proper behaviour on flights. Alexis explains that they didnapost travel in premium cabins until her kids were at least four years old because at that age, they had more self-control and could manage their behaviour better. Flying in business class gives her kids the freedom to lie down, sleep, play games and watch films - and the other passengers rarely even know theyaposre there. She posed the controversial question to TikTok users, who were keen to give their opinion. Since being posted, the video has racked up almost , likes and  comments from ided viewers, with some saying they shouldnapost be allowed.One person said: Absolutely not. They should create a childrenaposs suite. Another added: I think Iaposd be madI saw them. Kids arenapost as quiet as parents pretend to think they are.While a third said: You didnapost understand the assignment. They should have appropriate behaviour in any section. But a few people didnapost see the problem.Greatthey can act like quiet adults, wrote one person.A second put: Honestly eventhey donapost behave you bought the tickets, they have the right to be there.Another wrote: WellI buy a ticket my child is next to me. No way Iaposm sitting in st and sheaposs where. I mean there are full-grown adults that didnapost know how to act on an aircraft sooo, said someone .There were also a few horror stories about babies ruining flights, like this one: I recently flew first class home from Hawaii and there was an infant who cried  screamed the entire way. Itaposs a lot of [money] to have to listen to that. What do you think  Should kids be allowed to fly first class  Let us know in the comments. Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: school dinner lady shares secrets
story: School dinner lady shares secrets from her job - and funniest questions kids ask herA school dinner lady from Norfolk has shared her experience of being in the industry and some of the funniest things she has seen children do during her shtsByBrogan-Leigh HurstShowbiz Reporter:,  Jan | comments A school dinner lady has revealed what weird questions she is asked and the astonishing things she sees kids do while on duty.Catering assistant Julie Pike, , from Norfolk, has been in the industry for eight years and she loves her job.She even lets people have a glimpse into her le by sharing videos on TikTok under the name @MummaPike. On her account, she recently uploaded a video titled the things I get asked as a school dinner lady.Her followers had plenty of burning questions, with one asking: How do you know how much food to make Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.She revealed: Meals are pre-ordered, portions counted weighed. Another asked: Do you still serve the cake with icing and sprinkles  Julie excitedly responded: Yes! The TikTok star was also asked: Do you still use an ice cream scoop to serve mash potatoes  And she wrote: Hell yeah! across the screen.  Julie then went on to reveal some of the funniest things she has seen kids do while at school. She shared: The children come out with funny things every day but one of the funniest things Iaposve heard was a child telling me they hadnapost been fed when Iaposd been off looking after one of my children who was sick. But some kids can be pretty gross too. The grossest thing Iaposve ever witnessed was a child cramming so much food in their mouth they were physically sick! The kids seem to tell me everything! I get all the gossip from the playground and often get told about their home lives too. Itaposs really interesting. Julie is passionate about her job, as she added: Iaposm in my eighth year of service. I love watching the children grow as they progress through school and giving them opportunities to try new foods they might not get at home. However, she added there are often untrue assumptions made about working as a dinner lady. One being that we only work one hour a day and weaposre all old and grumpy! she said. Julie concluded: We have to set up and clean down which takes quite a bit of time. I donapost think Iaposm old and Iaposm definitely not grumpy!Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. story: Woman blasts Tinder date for not being able to drive and says its a red flagA woman took to TikTok to share details of her first date, which seemingly didnt go very well as she criticised him for not being able to drive and many other red flags Image: AFP via Getty ImagesByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Jan | commentsA woman ided opinions online after she shared the red flag that put her off her date.Emma opened up about the first date that went so wrong it put her off dating for three years on her TikTok @emmathegat .In the video, which has been viewed almost , times, Emma explained that this was her first Tinder date after getting out of my relationship since high school, and why it was awful. She said: We matched, weaposre chatting, he looked really cute in the photo - like so cute Iaposm like I reckon heaposs a catfish because he looked too cute. But when it came to arranging to meet up in real le, her date mentioned he couldnapost drive, which she said was a massive red flag.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Just to be polite, she offered to pick him up, which he accepts. When the pair got to the restaurant, he questioned whether he should be paying for her as she recalls him asking: Do I have to pay for you  It gets worse though, she says. The buzzer goes off and he goes up to get his food and he comes back down and says aposah yours is over there by the way,apos and I was like aposyou couldnapost have just grabbed that apos Like what are you doing  The pair then went on to see a movie and despite Emma pointing out she didnapost want to see the latest Jurassic World film, her date decided to buy tickets for it anyway. When they leave, she said, he just assumes Iaposm gonna drive him home so he just gets in my car. But itaposs not her dateaposs behaviour that left viewers confused, but her red flag. Since being posted, the video has racked up more than , likes and , comments from ided viewers, with many saying that it wasnapost a red flag. One user said: How is not driving a red flag, though  Another added: How is not driving a red flag  You being bothered about that is a red flag. A third commented: Why is not driving a red flag though  Many people don’t own a car, it’s pretty normal. Others however were on her side, as one even said theyaposd swipe leftthey found out their date couldnapost drive. They wrote: If a man isn’t going to pick you up and pay for your meal then swipe left, a gentleman would never make women pay or pick her up! Another agreed, saying: Not driving is  per cent red flag. Every guy on tinder I talked to lost it either drink driving or speeding and then they brag about it. Not cute. Emma later responded to comments, saying: Can you guys chill about the driving comment like sorry but who doesnapost drive  What do you think  is not being able to drive a red flag Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: woman branded petty after getting
story: Woman branded petty after getting revenge on neighbour who moves her wheelie binsPayton Ramsay has shared how she was left feeling furious at neighbour for moving her wheelie bins - so she decided to take action to stop it from happening againShe was fed up of her neighbour moving her bins Image: tiktok @paytonramsayByBrogan-Leigh HurstShowbiz Reporter:,  Jan | commentsA woman was left so furious by her neighbour moving her bins that she took things to the next level and decided to try and stop her from doing it again. Payton Ramsay, from the US, claims she would get fed up of her next-door neighbour obsessively positioning the bins - and so decided to get revenge after coming up with a sneaky plan. However, some people have branded her actions petty. She filmed the other womanaposs reaction on a Ring doorbell, uploading the footage to TikTok to share what her neighbour is like with the rest of the world. After watching a city worker come to the house and move the bins before rubbish collection, Payton caught her neighbour moving her bins back, to be closer to her house. Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.Payton decided to make it harder for her neighbour to move the bins by rubbing grease on the bottom of the handles. In doorbell camera footage, her neighbour could be seen walking up to the bins and trying to move them, before she realised there was grease on the handles. She then huffed and puffed her way back into her house after noticing what had happened. Payton captioned the video: Neighbour from hell reaction to grease on the trash cans! But many of her followers thought her reaction was petty. At least she’s courteous to the truck driver and not immature like the person putting grease on the handle of the can… grow up and be respectful, one person wrote. Another penned: I donapost understand the issue here we just put em all out wherever we want, as long as its not blocking a car. However, others thought Paytonaposs idea was hilarious, with one saying: Hahahahahahahahahahahhaha I’m here for this kind of petty. A second added: OMG put some of that crazy colour temp colour underneath cause itaposs stains hands for days and itaposs easier to clean off after. Payton shared a further update in another video, telling her fans that her neighbour had toned things down since she uploaded the original clip to social media.What do you think  Let us know in the comments below.Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON TikTokViral" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news weird-news woman-hailed-absolute-icon-after-"Shrek fan gets tattoo of sound waves for All StarByJulia Banim:,  Jan | commentsTymarah Emily Shandaposs friends have long joked about her enduring love for Shrek, the  aposanti-fairytaleapos about a grumpy ogre who learns to open up his heart and swamp to others after venturing on a reluctant quest.However, nobody could have guessed that the -year-old would declare her devotion for the iconic Dreamworks film in such a lasting fashion, opting to have a Spoty code inked on her arm in tribute.For those whoaposve never heard of such a thing, a Spoty Code is a QR-like tag that you can scan to access tracks within Spoty. So when Tymarahaposs arm is scanned with a phone, All-Star - which die-hard fans will recall plays out as we get to know Shrek and his grouchy bachelor lestyle in the opening credits - will play out on Spoty.Thankfully, it works perfectly. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Tymarah from Greenhithe, Kent said: I thought it was so funny and it actually worked! I just think the song and film is hilarious.Personally, I donapost think Iaposll regret it. I have quite a lot of tattoos and itaposs just a few lines on the back of my arm. Iaposve seen far worse tattoos on people! Shrek-mad Tymarah first saw the comedy adventure at the cinema as a child and declares she has been obsessed ever since, much to her friendsapos amusement. The eyelash technician explained: Itaposs kind of like an ongoing joke between me and my friends that I like Shrek. I think we spoke about getting a Shrek tattoo once and whenever we are on a long drive I just play the song. I thought this would be better than a Shrek tattoo as it means something to me and my friends, not just a random Shrek tattoo! Tymarah had the unusual tat done at Sacred Empire Tattoo  Piercing in Tonbridge on Friday, January th. Sheaposd initially booked in to have a Japanese dragon inked on her forearm, however, before getting out of the chair, she askedthe artist could also throw add the small Spoty Code tattoo on her upper arm.  Although it took a four-hour session to complete her dragon tattoo, it took just ten minutes for the artist, who is also a friend of Tymarah, to add the usable code. The artist made a stencil using a code Tymarah herself had screenshotted from her Spoty app. According to Tymarah: She knows Iaposm crazy so she didnapost even blink an eyelid! If they change the software and it doesnapost work I wouldnapost care, itaposs a personal tattoo on my body and means something to me. I have other amazing art pieces tattooed on me and they donapost have any meaning, soanything Iaposm more likely to regret them than a tattoo with meaning.Tymarah believes that the ink will serve as a reminder of my group of friends and our humour, remarking that lots of people get matching tattoos with friends. Looking ahead to the future, she added: I think it will be so funny to explain to my kids or grandkids what the tattoo is for and play them the song. So many people have tattoos about movie or TV characters, I personally donapost think this is any dferent. Tymarah has since posted a vid of her getting the tattoo on her TikTok, @itstymarah, clocking up almost k likes at the time of writing.The video said: When you definitely just made the best decision of your le... Tell me Iaposm wrong  If every comment is youaposre wrong Iaposm going to die LOL. Thankfully there was plenty of support in the comments, with even the official Spoty account commenting to declare you are an ALL-STAR. Reflecting on how she felt about any potential criticism of her body art, Tymarah reasoned: Personally I think people get super sensitive about other peopleaposs tattoos, itaposs not on your body so why would you care  Have you opted for a funny or unusual tattoo Get in touch. title: worlds shortest iq test only
story: Worlds shortest IQ test only has three questions - but  percent fail itIf you love a quiz, weve got the perfect one for you to try your hand at - its the shortest IQ test in the world, comprising of just three questions - but fewer than one in five get it rightCan you pass the worlds shortest IQ test Image: GettyByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Jul Updated:,  Jan | commentsIf youaposve ever wanted to test your intelligence, but canapost be bothered to sit through a y IQ test, we may have the perfect solution for you. The worldaposs shortest IQ test is made up of just three maths questions and shouldnapost take too long to complete. But be warned - itaposs pretty tough! Called the Cognitive Reflection Test, the quiz isnapost new, but was originally part of a research paper published in  by MIT professor Shane Frederick. This paper has recently resurfaced online, leaving many keen to give it a go. As part of his research, Professor Frederick had more than , participants from a range of educational backgrounds complete the test - and even those attending top American universities such as Yale and Hard struggled to work out all the answers. Of all those who took part only  percent managed to score three out of three on the test, meaning  percent of people failed - how will you fare   Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Speaking about the test, Professor Frederick, said: The three items on the CRT are aposeasyapos in the sense that their solution is easily understood when explained, yet reaching the correct answer often requires the suppression of an erroneous answer that springs aposimpulsivelyapos to mind. Hereaposs a look at the questions: . A bat and a ball cost . in total. The bat costs  more than the ball. How much does the ball cost  . If it takes five machines five minutes to make five widgets, how long would it take  machines to make  widgets  . In a lake, there is a patch of lily pads. Every day, the patch doubles in size. If it takes  days for the patch to cover the entire lake, how long would it take for the patch to cover half of the lake   These are the three most common answers that people guess - but they are actually incorrect. .  cents .  minutes .  days Professor Frederick adds: Anyone who reflects upon it for even a moment would recognise that the dference between  and  cents is only  cents, not  as the problem stipulates. In this case, catching that error is tantamount to solving the problem, since nearly everyone who does not respond apos centsapos does, in fact give the correct response. The correct answers are: .  cents .  minutes .  days Still puzzled by all of this  Thankfully, Presh Talwalkar, the author of The Hoy of Game Theory: An Introduction to Strategic Thinking explained how to work out the correct answers on his blog, Mind Your Decisions. . Say the ball costs X. Then the bat costs  more, so it is X + . So we have bat + ball  X + . because together they cost .. This means X +   ., then X  ., so X  .. This means the ball costs  cents and the bat costs . . If it takes  machines  minutes to make  widgets, then it takes  machine  minutes to make  widget . If we have  machines working together, then each can make a widget in  minutes. So there will be  widgets in  minutes. . Every day FORWARD the patch doubles in size. So every day BACKWARDS means the patch halves in size. So on day  the lake is half full. How did you do  Let us know in the comments below. title: aisling murphy teachers tragic last
story: Ashling Murphy: Teachers tragic last post before being killed while joggingAshling Murphy shared a clip on Facebook of her playing a traditional Irish song with her sister. The -year-old teacher was killed while out jogging on the banks of Grand Canal in Tullamore, Co Offaly, IrelandAshling Murphys love of music was clear in her final Facebook post Image: PAByRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan School teacher Ashling Murphyaposs last social media post before she was killed was a tribute to her love of music, it has emerged. The -year-old was killed while out jogging, with her body found on the banks of Grand Canal in Tullamore, Co Offaly, Ireland, on January . Her final Facebook post in July  was a video showing her and her sister playing the fiddle and concertina with the caption: Happiest when.... The pair were performing a traditional Irish song in a kitchen. Ashling is smiling with her eyes closed. Jozef Puska, , has been charged with her murder. On Tuesday, large crowds gathered in the village of Mountbolus and outside St Brigidaposs Church, where her funeral was held. Mourners included Irish President Michael D Higgins and premier Micheal Martin. Addressing those who had gathered for her funeral, heartbroken boyfriend Ryan Casey broke down in tears as he said Ashling was the light of all the lives of those who knew her.  He said she was always there and always willing to help and put herself last. He said Ashling was so much more to me than a girlfriend, adding she is my soulmate, will always be my soulmate, she is the greatest love of my le. Around  people walked along the canal on Wednesday , close to where her body was found, to mark a week since her death.  Vigils have been held across Ireland and the world to remember Ashlinh and to call for a change in tackling gender-based violence. Puska was heckled as he was taken from a Garda car to a special sitting of Tullamore District Court on Wednesday evening. A large crowd gathered outside the courthouse as he was taken away by gardai. Detective Sergeant David Scahill gave evidence of the arrest and charge.  He told the court the accused was charged with murder at .pm on Wednesday. Det Sgt Scahill told the court that when he was charged with the offence, Puska replied: No. Defence solicitor Eoin Lysaght made an application for legal aid and for the services of an interpreter for the future court appearance. The court was told that Puska, who was wearing a grey jumper and grey tracksuit bottoms, is a Slovakian national. A statement of his means was provided to the court during the brief hearing.  District Judge Catherine Staines remanded Puska in custody to appear at Cloverhill District Court on January . A number of family members stood in court with framed pictures of Ms Murphy. A second man, arrested under Section  of the Offences Against the State Act , has been released without charge. A file is to be prepared for the Office of the Director of Public Prosecutions.Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON EducationFuneralsMurderSchoolsCrime" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: judge bans unvaccinated dad seeing
story: Judge bans unvaccinated dad from seeing -year-old child until he has Covid jabA judge in Quebec, Canada ruled it was not in the best interest for the father to have contact with the child - the mum raised concerns after discovering the father was unvaccinated from his social media postsA dad has been banned from visiting his child unless he gets a Covid- jabImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments An unvaccinated dad has been banned from visiting his child until he gets his Covid- jab.The father was stopped from seeing his child after a judge ruled it was not in the best interest for him to have contact with the -year-old.Superior Court Judge Jean-Sébastien Vaillancourt said that it would normally have been in the best interest of the child to have contact with his father, but not in his best interest to have contact with himhe is not vaccinated and is opposed to health measures in the current epidemiological context, Canadian newspaper Le Devoir reported. His visitation rights have been suspended until February, unless the dad gets vaccinated before then. The judgement came after the dad had requested an extra day with his child over the holiday period, according to local reports in Quebec, Canada.Whose side are you on  Have your say in the comment section The mum contested the request after learning from his social media posts that he was not vaccinated. She further requested a suspension of his visitation rights, claiming he would be a conspirator and anti-vaccine. The child has received both their jabs, but the mum lives with her partner and other children under the age of five who are not yet able to get vaccinated. The judge said: In these circumstances, it is not in the best interests of any of the three children that Monsieur can exercise access toat this time.  for our daily newsletter to keep up to date with all the essential information atwww.mirror email.This is not the first reported case of a parent being denied visitation for not having their Covid- vaccine. In New York, a dad was banned from visiting his daughter unless he becomes double-jabbed or agrees to weekly Covid tests. The ruling was made by a New York City orce judge, who suspended the parentaposs visitation rights to see the three-year-old girl until he agrees to either option. Matthew Cooper, who is presiding over the estranged coupleaposs orce and custody dispute, wrote in his ruling: “Here, in-person parental access by the defendant is not in the child’s best interests, and there are exceptional circumstances that support its suspension. “The dangers of voluntarily remaining unvaccinated during access with a child while the Covid- virus remains a threat to children’s health and safety cannot be understated. “Unfortunately, and to my mind, incomprehensibly, a sizeable minority, seizing upon misinformation, conspiracy theories, and muddled notions of ‘inidual liberty,’ have refused all entreaties to be vaccinated.” The ruling requires the unnamed dad to either get the jab or present a weekly PCR test in addition to a biweekly antigen test within  hours of a scheduled visit. He currently visits his daughter every other weekend. The judge wrote that the couple split in  and the proceedings have been contentious with the two wrangling over custody of their daughter. The child resides mostly with her mother in Manhattan, where she attends preschool. title: kitkat wrappers images hindu gods
story: KitKat wrappers with images of Hindu gods withdrawn after Nestle slammedKitKat wrappers featuring images of Hindu gods have been withdrawn by Nestle who have been blasted on social media with many unhappy that the covers will end up as rubbishKitKat chocolate bars with images of Hindu gods have been withdrawnByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Jan | commentsKitKat chocolate bars with images of Hindu gods on the wrappers have been blasted on social media with Nestle stating that they have been withdrawn. People in India have said it was offensive to have the pictures of Lord Jagannath, Balabhadra and Mata Subhadra on the covers of the bars which will end up being thrown away. Hindu’s complained at the idea of having images of these gods lying in dustbins or in the street. “This pic of BhagwanJagannath will end up on the road or trash cans. People will walk on it. Why are pics of Hindu Gods Goddesses used for marketing  tweeted one person. Another wrote: Please remove the Lord Jagannath, Balabhadra and Mata Subhadra photos in your @kitkat chocolate cover. When people are finished the chocolate they are through the cover on road, drain, dustbin, etc. So please remove the photos.  Similar comments included: Nestle kindly remove pics of our Godaposs from your wrapper KitKat... Till that time we Indians stand united in terms of not consuming any of your products.. Kindly learn from your mistakes and donapost repeat such acts again. Nestle India have said that they have already withdrawn the wrappers which were introduced as a part of the travel break packs to celebrate local destinations. The wrappers with images of Hindu gods were to highlight the Odisha culture. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  Nestle India tweeted: KitKat travel break packs are meant to celebrate beautul local destinations  last year we wanted to celebrate the culture of Odisha with designs on packs representing aposPattachitra’, an art form uniquely identiable by its vivid imagery. The visual was inspired by the government tourism website. We wanted to encourage people to know about the art  its artisans. Our past campaigns have also shown that consumers like to collect  keep such beautul designs. We do understand the sensitivity of the matter and regretwe have inadvertently hurt anyone’s sentiment. With immediate action we had already initiated withdrawal of these packs from the market. We thank you for your understanding and support. Nestle has been approached for comment. title: royal navy ship sent volcano
story: Royal Navy ship sent to volcano-hit Tonga as international relief efforts ramp upThe Royal Navys offshore patrol vessel, HMS Spey, is set to arrive in Tonga in the next few days bringing water and medical supplies for islands hit by the volcanic eruption and tsunamiThe Royal Navys offshore patrol vessel, HMS Spey, is sailing from Tahiti to Tonga Image: Greg Martin   Cornwall LiveByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Jan | commentsA Royal Navy ship is heading to Tonga with vital supplies to help the humanitarian crisis on the islands following the volcanic eruption and tsunami. Further UK-funded aid is also heading to the islands to help the relief effort on board HMAS Adelaide, of the Australian navy, include almost  tents. The Royal Navyaposs offshore patrol vessel, HMS Spey, is sailing from Tahiti to Tonga carrying water and medical supplies and is expected to arrive in the next few days. The aid on HMAS Adelaide has already arrived in Tonga as has more relief as part of New Zealand’s support on Navy ship HMNZS Wellington.Foreign Secretary, Liz Truss, said: Our thoughts are with those caught up in the appalling devastation and loss of le caused by the tsunami in Tonga. The UK has also offered to fund the deployment of crisis experts through the United Nations. UN humanitarian officials estimate that about , people - more than % of Tongaaposs population - have been affected by the eruption of an undersea volcano, which has led to deaths, injuries, loss of homes and polluted water. The Hunga Tonga-Hunga Haaposapai volcano erupted on Saturday, triggering a tsunami which has caused devastation across the archipelago nation.  HMAS Adelaide will set sail on Friday carrying British aid including  family tents, eight community tents and six wheel barrows, with all items provided at the request of the Tongan government.Defence Secretary, Ben Wallace, instructed HMS Spey to sail to Tonga to assist in the humanitarian aid operation.He, reported the , said: “In response to the [eruption] in the Pacic Ocean, I have instructed HMS Spey to sail to Tonga to assist in the humanitarian aid operation.  “The UK will work closely with Australia and New Zealand to assist the recovery effort in Tonga and stands ready to support our long-standing Commonwealth partner.” HMS Spey is due to arrive in Tonga next week and the vesselaposs commanding officer, Commander Mike Proudman, said: Iaposm proud that the Royal Navy can play its part in the efforts to respond to the devastating volcanic eruption and tsunami in Tonga. news world-news sas-standby-extract-uk-officials-"Russian military vehicles prepare for transportByChris HughesDefence and Security Editor:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A secretive SAS unit has been put on standby to “extract” UK officials from Ukrainewar breaks out, the Daily Mirror can reveal. Members of SAS E Squadron will lead a rescueRussian troops and armour pour deep into Ukraine.As many as , Russian combat forces are now amassed close to Ukraine’s border - including ground troops and amphibious attack personnel.More are pouring into neighbouring Belarus, putting Ukraine’s capital Kiev at riskPresident Vladimir Putin orders a full-scale invasion.Moscow’s commanders have ordered large amounts of multi-launch rocket systems to be transported into Belarus, which could be used as a launch point for an invasion. American President Joe Biden has already warned he believes an attack is “imminent” and bungled by hinting an American response depends on the severity of an incursion.Many observers believe full-scale invasion is unlikely butthat takes place British Foreign Office officials may be rescued by special forces. It is believed crack UK special forces may also be placed strategically within Ukraine acting as military advisers, along with US counterparts.  One security source told the Daily Mirror: “British intelligence is watching developments all over Ukraine but in particular in Crimea, which is occupied by Russian forces. “All of the other manoeuvres may have been a ruse to deflect from Crimea and Putin may want to expand it towards contested Donbas.”Tonight the UK Ministry of Defence told the Daily Mirror: We do not comment on special forces. Ukraine’s troops along a -mile trench border through Donbas, in Donestk and Luhansk, are on high alert for an attack by Moscow’s forces. They are preparing to launch a guerrilla warfare against attacking Russian soldiersthey roll over the frontline, using UK-supplied shoulder-launched NLAW missiles. They have pitted crossing points with anti-tank mines and other defences, preparing to retreat and then launch counter-attacks against an invasion force. Experts warned Russia will act quickly and decisivelyit invades. aposRussia to act quickly and decisively in invasion of Ukraineapos Hugo Crosthwaite, lead analyst for Eurasia at security intelligence firm Dragonfly, said the Russian plan was to get concessions on Ukrainian NATO membership and Donbas. Putin is keen to stop Ukraine from becoming a NATO member but the US has insisted on making no promise. Moscow also wants pro-Russian separatist occupied Donbas to be officially part of Russia and some experts believe sanction threats will not deter the Kremlin. He said: “A Russian invasion of Ukraine is a likely scenario in the coming weeks. “There have been several military and diplomatic developments that point to a sustained severe interstate conflict risk, including Russian troops deploying to Belarus and further efforts by the Kremlin to create a pretext for an attack.  “The combined efforts of the US, the EU and NATO to deter Russia in recent months appear to have failed. “Even the sanctions the US has threatened seem to have had little impact, with Russia having effectively sanction-proofed its economy. “Russia’s military build-up means it can now begin a ground operation or launch a devastating missile and artillery attack at little to no notice. “Rhetoric from the Kremlin has become more belligerent, including unevidenced accusations that the US is training ‘anti-Russia’ units and Ukraine is preparing to attack separatist forces in Donbas - a tactic the Kremlin used in  to justy its annexation of Crimea. “We still doubt that Russian forces would attack Kyiv, either via ground assault or air and missiles, and assess that Russia’s main goal in any military operation would be to force Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky to resign quickly, and offer wide-ranging concessions from NATO membership to the status of Donbas.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON NatoEuropean UnionForeign OfficeMinistry of DefenceJoe BidenVladimir PutinSoldiersSpecial forcesUkraine crisisRussiaDaily Mirror,callToAction:ltpgtGet weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emaillt pgt,buttonText:,contentId:,newsletterImage:https:i-prod.mirror article.ece ALTERNATES sd _AlisonHeaderFinal.png,endpointUrl:https:response.pure interface list.php,profile:Reach_Mirror,isPureNewsLetter:true,pureMailingListId:Mirror - news world-news vladimir-putins-pole-dancing-room-"Russia: Inside Putin’s £ billion palaceByWill StewartRussia Correspondent:,  Jan | comments A new picture of a pole-dancing boudoir inside Vladimir Putin ’s alleged £ billion Black Sea palace has been released by jailed opposition leader Alexei Navalny’s team.The gargantuan pile at Gelendzhik was shown earlier in computer images based on leaked detailed plans of the property. But now Navalnyaposs team claim to have found thousands of actual photographs of the palace confirming a “striptease” room known as a “hookah” with a stage and a performer’s pole. The striptease hall, hookah, call it what you want, really exists,” says a commentary with a video on the new pictures. “And it looks much worse than we could imagine.”  A computer-generated image shows how the Navalny team had imagined the pole-dancing boudoir a year ago based on leaked plans which also included a casino and aqua disco. A photograph shows what they claim is the striptease room reality in the palace when it was still under construction. “The stage is littered with pillows,” said the commentary.  A pulsating light appears above and behind where the dancer would perform. “We donapost even know how to describe it. A portal  A silhouette of a temple dome ” Other images show the Russian leaderaposs bedroom, a second bedroom and his office, as well as a swimming pool, they claim. The double-headed eagle symbol of Russia is found throughout the palace, appearing to give it an official seal. Amid controversy over the palace stoked by Putin enemy Navalny, a year ago oligarch Arkady Rotenberg denied it belonged to the President and said he owned the sprawling clftop property overlooking the Black Sea. Billionaire Rotenberg is Putin’s former judo sparring partner and perhaps closest friend from childhood. At the time the tycoon explained: “This is a stunning place. We would like to build an apart-hotel there, this is why it has so many rooms.” He told the media without going into detail that he had managed to “become a beneficiary” of the well-guarded property.  The high-security palace reportedly includes a “-storey underground complex” compared with the lair of a James Bond villain. It was also described as “a whole anthill in the rock under the house”. An engineer-turned-whistleblower who reportedly worked on the construction - named only as Viktor - thought of the palace as a “national treasure” suggesting the underground passageways buried in the rock were more ingenious than Dr No’s bunker. The palace designs included on the eighth subterranean floor a balcony - literally a loggia hanging over the sea built into the clf, from which the owner can enjoy wine tasting from the palace stocks, he said. It is, however, far from clear that Putin has ever lived here and a year ago it appeared to be undergoing reconstruction. The Kremlin has denied that it is the President’s private home. Lawyer, anti-corruption campaigner and protest leader Navalny - seen as Putin’s number one enemy - is in jail but is seen in the West as a political prisoner. title: dundee mans journey from traumatic offshore accident to shop opening
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Eveningcontent online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Courier. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Tayside and Fe.
